query: Mid-State Gravel Grinder gravel race Central Pennsylvania

videos.title: Why Do Trans-sylvania Gravel Epic?
videos.description:
Riders at the 2022 edition of Trans-sylania Gravel Epic in central Pennsylvania talk about their favorite parts of the 4 day gravel stage race. 

https://www.tsegravel.com/

videos.title: Middle Creek Gravel Grinder 2019
videos.description: Completed my first gravel bike race/ride. The Middle Creek Gravel Grinder was a great race on a perfect day for cycling. While I've got a long way to go in regards to my training I'm excited to try another one and come back next year to improve my times. This is the medium gravel route - I'm nowhere near XL shape.

videos.title: Keystone Gravel 2021
videos.description: Course video from the 2021 Keystone Gravel Gravelduro near Jersey Shore, PA.  It was a perfect day and an epic course with over 10,000 feet of climbing in 80 miles.  This is not your ordinary gravel grinder!  No mass start this year.

Thinking about diving into gravel cycling? I've spent years making mistakes, testing gear, and refining my approach—so you don't have to. Here's what every new gravel cyclist needs to know before hitting the trails.

videos.title: Trans-Sylvania Gravel Epic 2022 Stage 3 Rothrock Forest
videos.description:
With under 60miles and less than 100ft/mile of climbing this stage was fixing to be fast. Then add in some additional 2 day racers like Gordon and we were set to rip through Rothrock. This was the most scenic stage so far, Though, not in the sense of beautiful vistas because we were deep in the canopy most of the time. However, the thick old growth, damp roads, and deep green cover was putting off PNW vibes. 

A big group of 6 or so rolled early. Then stayed together until just after the aid. Eddie pushed up a stair stepping double track into a longer chunky descent. We got a gap over the top and likely extended it on the way down. From there it was 15 miles to the finish with no major climbs. 

Eddie tried to shake me on the final 5 min climb up into camp but I held on and led into the final corner, grabbing the W!

One more day!

These videos take a lot of  time to make and sometimes the adventures are expensive. If you feel like donating to encourage/help me offset costs, THANKYOU! Your contribution is greatly appreciated and gives me the resources to provide y'all more content. 
Venmo: www.venmo.com/u/Kerry-Werner-1
paypal: https://www.paypal.com/paypalme/kerrywerner

https://bike.shimano.com/en-US/home.html
https://www.konaworld.com
https://www.maxxis.com/tires/bicycle
